meanings.definition: Inclined to avoid work or exertion; idle
meanings.sent1: He is lazier than his brother when it comes to chores.
meanings.sent2: The cat looked lazier than usual, lounging in the sun all day.
meanings.sent3: The lazier squirrel decided to nap instead of gathering nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt lazier than a sloth on a hot day, refusing to focus.
meanings.sent5: The lazier students always find excuses to skip homework.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a lack of effort or activity
meanings.sent1: The lazier approach may save time but sacrifices quality.
meanings.sent2: His lazier attitude towards exercise led to a decline in fitness.
meanings.sent3: The lazier route through the forest was overgrown and full of obstacles.
meanings.sent4: The lazier river meandered slowly through the valley, taking its time.
meanings.sent5: The lazier employees often miss important deadlines due to procrastination.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of willingness to work or use energy
meanings.sent1: She gave a lazier response this time, showing no interest in the project.
meanings.sent2: The lazier students preferred to copy rather than think for themselves.
meanings.sent3: The lazier dog refused to fetch the ball, lying down instead.
meanings.sent4: His eyes had a lazier look, lacking the spark of motivation.
meanings.sent5: The lazier workers complained about every task, avoiding effort.
